All Classes

Class Description
Ball
This is the class used to represent the ball object in the Brick Game.
BallInterface
BallInterface is an interface used to make the creation of different types of balls easier and flexible.
BallTest  
BigBall
This is the BigBall class that extends from the Ball class, used in Level 5.
Brick
The Brick Class refers to a singular brick we see above the game.
CementBrick
The Cement Brick refers to bricks that are grey in color and from cracks on impact.
CementBrickTest  
ClayBrick
The ClayBrick class refers to the default brick we see in game.
ClayBrickTest  
ColorBrick
Color brick extends the Brick class directly.
ColorBrickTest  
Crack
The Crack Class focuses on the cracks that are placed on the bricks (Cement) Refactoring - Removed "inMiddle" and "jumps" method.
DebugConsole
This class is used to setup the DebugConsole as a frame.
DebugPanel
This is the class for the Debug Panel which helps the user Select the Level, Reset the ball count and to set the ball speed.
Drawable
This interface is used to draw the different in-game objects.
DrawBall
DrawBall class which implements the Drawable interface.
DrawBrick
DrawBrick class which implements the Drawable interface.
DrawFactory
Factory method design pattern used to create an in-game object and to draw it onto the screen.
DrawPlayer
DrawPlayer class which implements the Drawable interface.
GameBoard
This class draws all of the 2d Components required to load the home screen and to play the game.
GameFrame
This class is what holds the whole frame of the Game to be displayed.
GamePlay
This class is responsible for the general game play of the Brick Game (interactions between components and it keeps track of in game scores).
GamePlayTest  
GraphicsMain
This is the GraphicsMain Class which consists of the main() method to run the entire Brick Game.
HalvePlayerDrop
This class is responsible for the level 5 power drop that halves the width of the player bar - Penalty to game more challenging and exciting.
HalvePlayerDropTest  
HighScore
This class is responsible for the handling and displaying of the permanent high scores to the game frame.
HomeMenu
HomeMenu class is used to design the Home Screen we see when we first load the game.
IncreaseSpeedDrop
This class is responsible for the level 5 power drop that drastically increases the speed of the ball - Penalty to game more challenging and exciting.
IncreaseSpeedDropTest  
InfoScreen
This Class is responsible for displaying the How to Play screen when user clicks on Info in Main Menu.
LevelScore
This class is responsible for accessing the permanent level high scores and displaying them when a level is completed or if player loses.
PauseMenu
This class is responsible for displaying the pause menu in screen when Esc is pressed mid game.
Player
This class represents the Player's bar (Rectangle) which he/she controls.
PlayerTest  
RubberBall
This is the class for Rubber Ball which inherits from Ball, used in levels 1-4.
SaveScores
This class is responsible for saving both level scores and high scores into files so that they can be stored permanently.
SteelBrick
The Steel Brick refers to bricks that are grey in color and break on probability.
SteelBrickTest  
WallSetup
This class is responsible for setting up the different brick formations (Wall setup) and types of bricks for each Level in the game.
